title: 2026 French municipal elections: The right and far right remain mostly divided
subhed: Despite some local elected officials coming closer together and an increasingly volatile electorate, there have been no mass movements from the right toward the far-right Rassemblement National ahead of the March 15 and 22 elections.
byline: By Benoît Floc’h, Clément Guillou and Alexandre Pedro

title: Epstein affair: French foreign ministry in turmoil after allegations against diplomat Fabrice Aidan

title: Macron urges calm after far-right activist fatally beaten
US ambassador's highly undiplomatic remarks spark controversy in Poland
subhed: The US ambassador in Warsaw, Thomas Rose, has decided to cut all contact with the president of Poland's lower house, after the latter spoke out against awarding the Nobel Peace Prize to Donald Trump.

title: Syria's Al-Hol camp emptied after mass escape of jihadist families
subhed: After the withdrawal of Kurdish forces on January 20 and under pressure from the Syrian army, the camp was emptied of most of its 24,000 residents, including 6,300 women and children of foreign jihadists.

title: Five vegan restaurants in Paris for food lovers
subhed: Whether you're looking for a quick lunch or a gourmet dinner, here is Le Monde's selection of 100% plant-based restaurants in the French capital.

title: 'By sacrificing American soft power, Trump is exacerbating his country's unpopularity and prompting Europeans to exercise their own'
subhed: Distrust toward the US continues to grow, even among its closest allies. The American president's hardline approach could encourage Europe to promote its values, freedoms and way of life, writes Le Monde columnist Philippe Bernard.

title: The Iranian protesters killed by regime gunfire on January 8
subhed: Sina Ashkbousi, Behrouz Mansouri, Mansoureh Heydari, Keyvan Moradi Mirani and Roubina Aminian were killed on the first day of protests against the Iranian regime. Their stories reflect both the diversity of the protest movement and the brutality of the crackdown.

title: As dating fatigue sets in, friends step in as Cupid
subhed: Letting a friend find the best match for you on Tinder or make a PowerPoint presentation about you during a 'pitch dating' event: As romance becomes a team sport, friends are stepping up to the plate.

title: How the Ivorian president's niece acted as Epstein's go-between
subhed: The Epstein files reveal the close relationship between the late financier and Nina Keita, who introduced him to young women and local business leaders. The niece of Côte d'Ivoire's president, Alassane Ouattara, now holds a senior position in Abidjan.
